reviewText: If somebody wants to know how the Mexican legal system works he or she has to watch this movie. It is a version of a real process filmed inside the court, something that was totally forbidden before this movie was done.
This was a gift for my son that he requested.  He liked it and he was also pleased with it.

This is a startling view of the Mexican criminal justice system. While it is in Spanish, it does have subtitles in English and French. This is a must see movie, particularly for lawyers and judicial employees; or anyone who had any connection with court systems.
It is hard to believe this documentary was actually made. It is a searing report of the lack of justice for the poor in Mexico.

The Economist magazine recently did a lengthy review of this film and gave it very high marks. It sounds a bit like a Mexican version of Thin Blue Line. I was pleased to see that the film is now available through Amazon.  However, I didn't buy it because I don't speak Spanish and there is no indication in the product description as to whether there are sub-titles in a language that I can read.

This movie has created tremendous mix of emotions in Mexico City because it potrays the Reality of the Judicial System in the correctional system in Mexico.
An individual accused of a crime he did not commited is followed through a system of corruption ,lies, and betrayal by the very same people who try to find him guilty or inocent.
Very interesting documentary to show the  World the corrupted Legal System in Mexico City.
A must see movie.
